title: Strictly’s Will Bayley had special shoes made for the show
text:
Will Bayley danced the Pokemon Paso Doble last Saturday (Picture: BBC)

Will Bayley has revealed he had special shoes made to compete on Strictly Come Dancing.

The 31-year-old table tennis player, who won gold at the Rio 2016 Paralympics, was born with arthrogryposis – a condition which causes curved joints affecting all four of his limbs.

Speaking about dancing with the condition, Will revealed how partner Janette Manrara doesn’t hold back on the criticism despite the extra hurdle.

‘I thought she might be soft on me because of my difficulties, but she tells me straight, which is the best way,’ Will told Closer magazine. ‘She’s adapted it really well for me.

Will Bayley has proved a hit on Strictly (Picture: BBC)

‘She’s really flexible and we work on the choreography together, because some of the moves are impossible. She brings out the best of me.

‘I had special shoes made, which give me extra balance, and they’ve made a big difference.’

On this week’s live show, Will is set to dance the Foxtrot to Senorita by Shawn Mendes and Camila Cabello, following last week’s bizarre Pokemon Paso Doble mash-up.

After earning 24 and 23 points in the two live shows so far respectively, Will is probably hoping to prove he’s on the score ascent as we enter the third week.

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday BBC One at 6.40pm.
